definition: to parrot/to repeat uncritically what sb says
parrot
parrot
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
tongue

sentences.english: Besides like learning to say parrot fashion.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿喜欢鹦鹉学舌一样学话。

sentences.english: The little boy always parrots what others say.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩总喜欢鹦鹉学舌。

sentences.english: He talks like a parrot and just repeats what he heard.
sentences.chinese: 他只是鹦鹉学舌，拾人牙慧罢了。

sentences.english: I wish you would quit leading this parrot here.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望您别在这里引这只鹦鹉学舌了。

sentences.english: He's merely parroting what many others have said.
sentences.chinese: 他不过是鹦鹉学舌，重复许多人说过的话而已。

sentences.english: Parrot speech is commonly regarded as the brainless squawking of a feathered voice recorder.
sentences.chinese: 鹦鹉学舌往往被认为是一种不通过大脑的模仿。

sentences.english: They can copy, "parrot like," and that is about all.
sentences.chinese: 她们只会模仿，“鹦鹉学舌”，仅此而已。

definition: to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
a wooden word-by-word reading
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
tongue-twister
to speak harshly but without any bad intent (idiom)
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
confused/disorderly/incoherent
strange accent/odd manner of speaking or singing
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
yes-man/opinionless person
